definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: In China, more and more people are concerned about learning and double bass .
sentences.chinese: 在我国，越来越多的人学习和关注低音提琴。

sentences.english: I play bass-guitar too, but mainly use the double bass when I play jazz.
sentences.chinese: 我弹爵士乐时主要用的就是那把低音提琴。

sentences.english: One of these lows will move across Tasmania and the Bass Strait.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一个低点搬到塔斯马尼亚岛和低音提琴海峡。

sentences.english: Has your eye been drawn to the sole female in the double bass section?
sentences.chinese: 你的眼有否注意到低音提琴部，那个唯一的女性？

sentences.english: The double bass and the oboe have different timbres.
sentences.chinese: 双簧管与低音提琴的音色不同。

definition: double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
instrument of the violin family (violin, viola, cello or double bass)/CL:把[ba3]
